title.narrative: State Bank of Vietnam – Cash Management

description.narrative: The main purpose of this project is to strengthen the bilateral relationship with the relevant Vietnamese authority of the State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) and to investigate the interest for cooperation and explore business opportunities for Dutch companies. This cooperation from the Dutch perspective is twofold. First, there is potential for cooperation and business in the area of cash management. The incoming visit may hopefully result in a common understanding on how to further establish mutually beneficial cooperation in the near future. Secondly, although at a more early stage, it is to become clear to what extent there may also be an interest in the area of financial services.The incoming mission (3 till 7 May 2012) consists of high level delegates of the State Bank of Vietnam. SBV is a relevant institution for Dutch financial sector companies to enter the market in Vietnam, both for the provision of financial services (banking, insurance) as for the supply of goods and services. The incoming mission will also be connected to Dutch companies that manufacture and sell cash currency related products and services. Some of these are organised in the Dutch Currency Association (DCA).Another invitee is Holland Financial Centre (HFC) which is a branch organisation in the financial sector. HFC has been invited to see what other angles from Dutch commercial interest may be relevant and match Vietnamese demand. HFC indicated interest in the services and supply market for electronic payments.
